question: Which of the following thread labeling methods is incorrect().<image 1>
description:
The image shows four different diagrams labeled (a), (b), (c), and (d). Each diagram represents a cross-sectional view of a cylindrical object with threads. 

- Diagram (a) shows a single thread with a single line indicating the thread profile.
- Diagram (b) shows a single thread with two lines indicating the thread profile.
- Diagram (c) shows multiple threads with two lines indicating the thread profile.
- Diagram (d) shows a single thread with a single line indicating the thread profile.

Based on standard thread labeling methods, diagram (b) is incorrect because it uses two lines to indicate a single thread, which is not typical in thread representation.
